intro: Pseudognaphalium elegans, commonly known as the elegant everlasting flower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds that allow it to colonize various habitats. Due to its resilience and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and used in floral arrangements.
